review_title: A good place to start (not much else)
pros: A good place for young teens to get their foot in the door for retail work without a Resume or CV. It's great for building experience in the workplace early on to be able to move onto other (and quite frankly better) jobs.
cons: After a few months it becomes an unbearable working environment. Managers tend to have no regard for the mental health of crew members. Hours become quite long very quickly and the work is incredibly draining for the pay: $18hr on weekdays, $20hr on Saturdays $22hr on Sundays, $36hr on public holidays. My recommendation is to work here for about half a year to gain experience, then move onto another retail job AS SOON AS POSSIBLE!!

- you chose your own hours(pretty flexible) 
- good first job for experience with people, handling money, customer service, multi tasking
cons:
- working long hours/shifts for 8-11 hours is obviously tiring in any job but at mcdonalds theres never any sitting down you stand and walk the entire time so that is extremely tiring on your body, at any age. 
- pay is not much higher than the us minimum federal wage. 
- You constantly deal with angry and very rude customers that take everything out on you. 
- high stress is literally all this job was, and theres was little to no training.
